chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (3rd) and OWI (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (3rd) and the other charge, OWI (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Brian J Gendron was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Brian J Gendron was found guilty of Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Zero credit for time served
Granted Work Release and Good Time
Begin serving immediately

Notice to Def-installation of ignition interlock device, cost reduction on IID, and links to Information on DMV website.
Mandatory interlock for all alcohol concentration-License restricted to interlocked vehicles, plus all registered and titled vehicles (unless exempted) for a period of no less than one year BEGINNING when the license is issued.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.
The Def is to provide a DNA specimen upon arrival to jail

16CM48 and 16TR281   11:00 AM Defendant Brian J Gendron in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.   RDK appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Move to dismiss 16TR281 - and Count 1 in 16CM48 as well as any other citations.  JR 150 fine plus costs on Count 2  JR on Ct 3: PAC 1744.00 60 days jail 24 mo DLR 24 Ig Interlock on all vehicles, mandatory AODA assess and FT.  Court orders:  16CM48 - Ct 2 of the Amended CC charges OAR - Ct 3 - PAC  3rd Offense - Plea to both counts:  No Contest.  Admits as it relates to Count 3 that this is his 3rd conviction.  Count 1 -- dismissed.  Case 16TR281 - dismissed.  Signed PQ - read compl before signed it, understand it, discussed with atty.  Court accepts pleas of NC and finds guilty.  Court orders convicted of OAR while revoked, and PAC - 3rd offense.  Sentence:  Count 2:  Pay a fine 150 plus costs for a total of $674.10, Count 3:  pay a fine plus costs 1831.20.  60 days jail, no credit for time served.   wk release/good time, jail time to commense - operat priv revoked 24 mo date of suspension, ignition interlock devise, ct grants a 50%reduction in fee that def has to pay for installation and service.  AODA and FT, before his regular operating privi may be reinstated.  Provide a DNA spec and do that upon arrival at jail.  payment plan 50/mo to be added to other payment plan.   Talk to Jail Staff regarding ATN Number.       Schedule motion for modification of bail on the new felony - relates only to his own children - 9:45 a.m. June 27, 2016.

Defendant Brian J Gendron in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16TR281,16CM48. Scott Morland called and sworn exam by DA. 615 2nd Ave W address for def. 4:15pm cross exam by atty Hoffmann. redirect by DA 4:21pm. redirect by Atty 4:22pm. No other questions for witness. Atty Hoffmann calls Defendant as witness, sworn, exam. cross exam by DA 4:33pm. redirect by Atty Hoffmann 4:40pm. witness can stand down. Alyssa Gendron called by Atty Hoffmann sworn and exam. Married to Def. Sophie is 5 years old. no recross. closing arguments by DA wants def bound over.  Atty states that Def was watching children, but that def must have intentionally neglect, atty states that the evidence was., Ct finds prob cause def committed crimes in Ashland Co, bound over for argn. Info filed, Def waives rights, waives reading. CT finds upon def stands mute, NG entered for def. Demand for speedy trial filed. 12 person jury trial Number 1 spot, Stc 8/22/16 @ 1:45pm. There is a offer for the CM case. to set that when the court has time. 16CM48 PLEAS 6/16/16 @ 11:00am. Will talk abotu scheduleing motion hearing tomorrow.  Jury trial scheduled for August 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brian J Gendron in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Time limits for prelim waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 04:00 pm. Plea and sentencing on other case at same time

Attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Hoffmann rec copy of amended compl, waives reading, Stands mute.  16TR281 continues to track  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
